SENT.plain: Between 1982 and 1991 we performed eight operations on seven patients with carotid artery aneurysms
Their mean age was 52.8 years (range: 20-67 years)
Five aneurysms were atherosclerotic, one was associated with Marfan's syndrome, and two were pseudoaneurysms, one occurring after Dacron patch angioplasty and the other due to tuberculosis
Seven aneurysms were treated electively; one patient underwent an emergency surgical procedure
In one case, the internal carotid artery was ligated
Regressive hemiparesis and ipsilateral Horner's syndrome developed in one patient
The follow-up period ranged from six months to nine and a half years
One patient died of myocardial infarction three months after surgery
